text: [Music]
hello everyone my name is bassem youssef
I've been called the John Stewart of
Egypt and I've been using that line in
order to make people relate to a more
famous personality because of my own
personal insecurity issues today I have
come to London to take over the BBC
finally I think the viewers here need a
much deeper and a more comprehensive
look to what is really happening in my
region I think that all news outlets and
the anchors have failed miserably to get
to the bottom of it I'm here to help and
I will start with the questions that you
have sent earlier to me first question
Isis bad not good for the planet that
was easy
second question should we be afraid feel
free to be afraid and if you don't the
news industry will think of something
else that will terrify you to death
should we bomb the Middle East and why
yes please we can't wait to be bombed
and I'm sure politicians will find a
very good excuse to make you happy next
question what do you think will happen
answer who the [ __ ] knows is there an
answer for all the madness that's
happening in the world answer 42 and if
you don't know what that is go read a
freaking book last question what can the
West do answer please don't do anything
you manage to screw things up and we
have been much better at screwing things
ourselves that's it for tonight ladies
and gentlemen if you thought that this
was confusing and absolutely useless
welcome to the world of news if you
think that it doesn't make any sense
and it's crazy welcome to the Middle
East this is bassem youssef for the
first and last time on BBC signing off
my worthless news
